intro: Polygonum cymosum, commonly known as redroot filaree, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems covered in fine, soft hairs. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a reddish tint along the veins. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters at the leaf axils, which bloom from late spring to early autumn.
